examples.sentence: お客様をお迎えします

examples.romaji_meaning: Tsutomesaki (Place of work) wa doko (where) desu ka (?)
examples.english: Where is your place of work?
I talk with people from my hometown.

examples.sentence: 南極の氷は冷たいです
examples.romaji: Nankyoku no koori wa tsumetai desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Nankyoku (Antarctic) no koori (ice) wa tsumetai (cold) desu (is)
examples.english: The ice of the Antarctic is cold.

examples.sentence: 努力が実を結びました
examples.romaji_meaning: Doryoku (Effort) ga mi o musubimashita (bore fruit)
Kotori (Small bird) ga naite imasu (is singing)
Kotori (Small bird) ga tonde imasu (is flying)

examples.english: We will hold the closing ceremony.
I will exchange the light bulb.

examples.romaji_meaning: Daigaku (University) ni zaigaku chuu (currently enrolled) desu (is)
examples.english: I am currently enrolled in university.

examples.sentence: 在学中に働いています
examples.romaji_meaning: Zaigaku chuu (While enrolled) ni hataraite imasu (working)

examples.english: I will not forget the favor.

examples.sentence: 親切な恩を感じています
examples.romaji: Shinsetsu na on o kanjite imasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Shinsetsu (Kind) na on (favor) o kanjite imasu (feel)
examples.english: I feel grateful for the kindness.

examples.sentence: 神社にお参りに行きます
examples.english: I go to worship at the shrine.

examples.sentence: お正月に初詣に行きました
examples.romaji_meaning: Oshougatsu (New Year) ni hatsumoude (first shrine visit) ni ikimashita (went)
examples.english: I went for my first shrine visit during New Year.

examples.sentence: ドアノブをひねります
この単語は略せますか？
examples.romaji_meaning: Kono (This) tango (word) wa ryakusemasu (can be abbreviated) ka (?)

examples.sentence: 矢印の方向に進みます
examples.english: I proceed in the direction of the arrow.

examples.sentence: 矢印に従ってください
形容詞は名詞を説明します
examples.romaji: Keiyoushi wa meishi o setsumei shimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Keiyoushi (Adjectives) wa meishi (noun) o setsumei (explain) shimasu (do)

examples.sentence: 下町は雰囲気がいいです
examples.romaji: Shitamachi wa fun'iki ga ii desu
examples.romaji_meaning: Shitamachi (Downtown) wa fun'iki (atmosphere) ga ii (good) desu (is)
examples.english: The atmosphere of the downtown is good.

examples.sentence: 長所と短所があります
examples.romaji_meaning: Chousho (Strength) to tansho (weakness) ga arimasu (there are)
Sukoshi (A little) kyuusoku (rest) ga hitsuyou (necessary) desu (is)

examples.sentence: 子供を自由に放します
examples.english: I let the child be free.
What kind of event is it?

examples.sentence: 目印になる建物があります
examples.romaji: Mejirushi ni naru tatemono ga arimasu
examples.romaji_meaning: Mejirushi (Landmark) ni naru (become) tatemono (building) ga arimasu (there is)
examples.english: There is a building that serves as a landmark.
